title: High Net Foreign Assets
description: In 2016, Iran's net foreign assets reached 2,473,743,911,927,340 LCU, indicating a strong international financial position.

title: Robust Government Expenditure
description: In 2023, Iran's general government final consumption expenditure was 18,422,330,000,000,000 LCU, reflecting substantial public sector investment.

title: Significant Household Consumption
description: Households and NPISHs final consumption expenditure in Iran was 71,941,643,000,000,000 LCU in 2023, showing strong domestic demand.

title: High Gross National Expenditure
description: In 2022, Iran's gross national expenditure was 100,190,975,344,245,000 LCU, indicating a high level of economic activity.

title: Strong Industrial Sector
description: In 2023, the value added by Iran's industry, including construction, was 51,842,958,000,000,000 LCU, highlighting industrial strength.

title: High GDP
description: Iran's GDP in 2023 was 143,039,267,000,000,000 LCU, reflecting a significant economic output.

title: Substantial Gross Domestic Savings
description: In 2023, Iran's gross domestic savings amounted to 52,675,294,000,000,000 LCU, indicating a strong savings culture.

title: High GNI
description: Iran's GNI in 2023 was 142,872,444,650,948,000 LCU, showcasing a robust national income.

title: Strong Educational Intake
description: In 2017, Iran achieved a net intake rate of 99.98% for females in grade 1, reflecting high educational enrollment.

title: High Imports of Goods and Services
description: In 2023, Iran's imports of goods and services were valued at 40,021,046,000,000,000 LCU, indicating strong international trade activity.

title: Discrepancy in GDP Estimates
description: In 2022, Iran faced a discrepancy in expenditure estimate of GDP amounting to 2,036,316,708,500,620 LCU, suggesting potential data inconsistencies.

title: High Official Exchange Rate
description: In 2023, Iran's official exchange rate was 42,000 LCU per US$, indicating currency valuation challenges.

title: Minimal External Debt Burden
description: In 2023, Iran's external debt stocks were only 2.45% of its Gross National Income (GNI), indicating a minimal debt burden compared to global standards.

title: Low Debt Service Ratio
description: Iran's total debt service was just 0.34% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income in 2023, showcasing efficient debt management.

title: Limited Bilateral Aid from Luxembourg
description: In 2022, Iran received minimal bilateral aid from Luxembourg, amounting to $9,999.99, reflecting limited financial support from this donor.

title: Negative External Balance on Goods and Services
description: Iran faced a significant external balance deficit of -5,403,951,000,000,000 LCU in 2023, indicating challenges in trade balance.

title: Discrepancy in GDP Expenditure Estimate
description: In 2022, there was a discrepancy of -195,940,706,686,100 LCU in Iran's GDP expenditure estimates, suggesting potential inaccuracies in economic data.

title: Negative Terms of Trade Adjustment
description: Iran experienced a negative terms of trade adjustment of -1,585,600,410,845,230 LCU in 2023, indicating unfavorable trade conditions.

title: Low Female Labor Force with Intermediate Education
description: In 2022, only 8.78% of Iran's female working-age population had intermediate education, highlighting a gap in educational attainment.

title: Minimal Present Value of External Debt
description: The present value of Iran's external debt was just 1.67% of its GNI in 2023, reflecting a low long-term debt burden.

title: Low Debt Service on Public and IMF Loans
description: In 2023, Iran's debt service on public and IMF loans was only 0.30% of its exports, indicating effective debt management strategies.

title: Minimal Present Value of Debt Relative to Exports
description: In 2023, the present value of Iran's external debt was only 6.31% of its exports, showcasing a sustainable debt level.
